abstract: Intel said that 5 percent of the Series 6, or Cougar Point, chipset, which recently started shipping, might fail over the next three to five years.
snippet: Intel said that 5 percent of the Series 6, or Cougar Point, chipset, which recently started shipping, might fail over the next three to five years.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Intel said on Monday it had stopped shipping a new chipset after discovering a design flaw that might cause 5 percent of the chips to fail over the next three to five years.

headline.main: Intel, Finding a Chip Flaw, Expects to Lose $1 Billion
headline.print_headline: Intel, Finding a Chip Flaw, Expects to Lose $1 Billion
